Generation II.Gold: It is said that it usually hides in underwater caves. It can create whirlpools by yawning.

Generation III.Ruby: Kingdra lives at extreme ocean depths that are otherwise uninhabited. It has long been believed that the yawning of this Pok é mon creates spiraling ocean currents.
Generation III.Sapphire: Kingdra sleeps on the seafloor where it is otherwise devoid of life. When a storm arrives, the Pok é mon is said to awaken and wander about in search of prey.
